Description: ServiceRequest.Read (Dental Procedure) allows a client to look up dental procedure details by providing a specific ServiceRequest ID. Dental procedures are individual actions (fillings, extractions, crowns, root canals, and so on) performed on a patient. They exist as part of a normal visit or an ad hoc visit. This resource can only return procedures by ID. If you need to query at the patient level, use the CarePlan (Dental CarePlan) resource.

ServiceRequest.Name: ServiceRequest
ServiceRequest.Description: An instance of the R4 ServiceRequest resource.

authoredOn.Name: authoredOn
authoredOn.Description: The date of creation of the associated request.

bodySite.Name: bodySite
bodySite.Description: The tooth, surface, and area of the mouth.

code.Name: code
code.Description: Procedure display name, code (D-code or other code), and code system.

intent.Name: intent
intent.Description:
The intent code. Epic supported values include:

  • order
  • plan

is-scannable-encounter.Name: extension
is-scannable-encounter.Description: If true, this order or procedure is scannable.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: Reference to the Practitioner that who placed the request.

reasonReference.Name: reasonReference
reasonReference.Description: Reference to a Condition resource for the request the request was made.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The status of the request. Supported values include:

  • draft
  • active
  • completed
  • revoked

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to a patient resource for whom the ServiceRequest was made.

supportingInfo.Name: supportingInfo
supportingInfo.Description: Procedure reference to the associated dental order. Populated only if the Epic organization has configured the Condition resource to show the relevant dental data.
